name: iQ Hotel Roma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the iQ in early October. This is a very chic modern hotel as shown on their website. We didn't mind the fact that it wasn't decorated in a Roman motif. We wanted a reasonably nice sized room, which we got. The rooms a simple but comfy. We didn't have the breakfast included and didn't end up eating breakfast there but we checked it out and it looked like a typical buffet with hot/cold selections. We opted for pastries and coffee at a coffee bar/liquor store just on the other side of the opera house. Great coffee.
reviews.title: iQ hotel not Roman but very nice..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some points:
reviews.title: Modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Clean, spacious rooms
reviews.title: Convenient, clean and forward thinking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Good wifi
reviews.title: Modern hotel in great location

reviews.text: 3. Quiet location about 10 minutes from Termini train station
reviews.title: IQ Works

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a 4 night stay in Rome based on trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. We stayed in a triple room where the double was made from two beds pushed together but u couldn't tell. The beds are firm which they seem to prefer in Europe. After mentioning this to reception they put on a foam topper. Bliss. The buffet was good although quiet so staff stood around and watched us eat. Awkward. Other big pluses are the free wi fi, laundry and big bathrooms. If IQ were a chain we would stay with them all through Italy
reviews.title: A must stay

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights in December. It's a modern hotel that serves its purpose of a well located base to explore Rome from. Would recommend if you are looking for a clean, well presented hotel and you are not interested in 5 Star luxury.
reviews.title: Good location, and well priced for a good base in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Such a friendly reception from the clerk on duty when we arrived. He was so so pleasant.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: Quiet location. Decor international bland but very functional and pleasant but you could be anywhere in the world. Room was very pleasant and comfortable and wonderfully quiet.
reviews.title: Just what we needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the vending machines with such reasonable prices and loved the way there was a little lending area for books in reception.
reviews.title: High iQ

reviews.text: This hotel is approximately 5 mins from the termini but don't let that put you off. I stopped for 5 nights in September, It's brand new,spotlessly clean and in one word AMAZING!!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in the centre of rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff cannot do enough to help you, the roof terrace is great (and dirt cheap compared to the prices around town), breakfast is cheap and satisfying, and the beds and rooms are top notch.
reviews.title: A great hotel, clean, modern, quiet and in an excellent location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not much more I can add that other people haven't already said on here, but if you get the chance I highly recommend this hotel to stop at
reviews.title: A gem! Brand new, trendy & super comfortable!

reviews.text: We loved this hotel. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The room was modern, clean and quiet with free wifi. Although the hotel did not have a restaurant but a full breakfast was served every morning on the roof level which had indoor or outdoor seating. There were vending machines that had food, beer and wine at good prices. We enjoyed a bottle of wine on the terrace one night after going out for dinner. There are several great restaurants nearby. The metro station was about 3 blocks, a 3-4min walk. The main termini was also a short walk. The coliseum was about a 15min walk.
reviews.title: Thank GOD there's a hotel like this in Rome for a decent price

reviews.text: This brand new hotel is a true gem! We spent weeks trying to find a reasonable hotel in a good location in Rome and luckily found the IQ hotel! After looking at 200+ hotels on the internet, we got an impression that Rome hotels are old, run down and expensive. IQ is the complete opposite - it's brand new and it has everything a traveller needs!
reviews.title: Best hotel we have ever stayed in

reviews.text: The Hotel was clean and modern with a helpful and pleasant staff.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Good beds (some noise from the street) and great breakfast.
reviews.title: Good Value and Great location

reviews.text: Well located.
reviews.title: Clean, helpful and modern.

reviews.text: We stayed at the IQ hotel for 3 nights on our way to Sicily. We found the hotel to fit our needs very well. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We payed 10 Euros for the continental breakfast and it was well worth it. In my opinion very good value for the money. We also used Real Rome Tours so we could see Rome in the short time frame we had. A great tour company...especially Fernando. They specialize in tours that cater to less that 12 people. Best of all every tour we went on there were no lines to wait....That was awesome!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As an American, I must admit I am spoiled and expect a lot from a hotel. We were treated respectfully and kindly by the staff. We arrived before check in and the hotel was very accomadating on storing out luggage under lock and key. The hotel is modern. The rooms (we stayed in a room with a king bed (2 singles pushed together) and 1 single bed for my mom) were kept very clean. My husband has back trouble and found the beds to be comfortable. When we asked for extra towels or toilet tissue, the staff was very accommodating. The rooms have safes and when we were unable to get into ours, the staff came quickly to open. As in most hotels, only very small bars of soap were provided and as in Paris no wash clothes so bring your own. The breakfast buffet is self serve and is very very nice. Again, the staff in the dining area were very
reviews.title: Great location, clean and crisp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in November for our honeymoon. I knew when I booked it that it was modern and not grand or traditional like a lot of hotels in Rome but we both loved it! the reception staff were very helpful when we checked in and out and the entire hotel is spotless. We stayed in room 101 which had a small balcony, very good for observing a little bit of life. The room was spacious enough for two but the bathroom was really generous with seperate bath and shower.
reviews.title: Excellent modern hotel

reviews.text: We paid extra for the breakfast which we both enjoyed although I stuck the the pastries. If you're from the UK and expecting a 'full English' then you will find the breakfast to be very European but it was plentiful and available until half ten which is a bonus.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located as you can walk to all the main sites including the Coloseum and the Trevi Fountain. There are plenty of restaurants nearby also and the termini station is very close. We even walked to the Vatican which takes about 40 mins but as it was 20 degrees C and sunny when we were there the walk was lovely.
reviews.title: Perfect home base in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the main selling point for us was the rooftop terrace. We took other travellers advice and took our blanket up there one night to enjoy some Frascati al fresco. The vending machine is brilliant and so cheap too, perfect for before or after dinner. The only way this hotel could be improved is if there were onsite facilities for dinner but walking around the nearby streets looking for a good place to stop was part of the charm of our visit.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The staff were very efficient during check-out and outlined all the options for us to get back to the airport. There is also a luggage room which is attended so a bellboy stows the bags for you. Not a hugely important detail but made the trip slightly more pleasant.
reviews.title: Modern and clean hotel, privacy, quick internet!

reviews.text: Stayed at iQ Hotel for 5 nights from 28 Nov - 3 Dec 2011. This is a great hotel. Modern, clean and comfortable. The rooms are reasonably sized, although the walls are a bit thin! The breakfast's good. No frills. I would still call it a 3-star hotel. However, it was more than satisfactory for my needs.
reviews.title: Superb location!!!

reviews.text: The location, however, is absolutely fantastic. As somebody else mentioned, you can easily walk to the great sights, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc. Perfect if you like exploring the streets. Metro stations are close by. The main junction, Stazione Termini, is a 5-minute walk from the hotel. So getting to the Colosseum or Vatican is easy.
reviews.title: Modern, Clean, Great Location

reviews.text: Would recommend it for first-time travellers to the city!
reviews.title: Fantastic relaxed hotel - good with kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After spending 2 weeks in Itlay, mostly in rented apartments, we decided to book this modern hotel for a stress-free few days before heading home. We loved it. The room was not huge but large enough for us and a comfoprtable cot for our daughter. The hotel was very modern and clean and walkable to many major sights. Since it's fairly close to the train station, all the major bus lines are also nearby. We decided not to pay for breakfast at the hotel, since it's a bit pricey, but found terrific cafes nearby where we breakfasted with the locals. Nice feature: the hotel vending machines provide very adequate coffee, espresso, capucino, and even wines and snack! I would not hesitate to receommend this hotel.
reviews.title: IQ Hotel, Roma - surpassed our expectations

reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel - its clean, spacious, great location - we walked to Trevi Fountain and Colosseum and Piazza Venezia - all around from here with kids. Very helpful, friendly staff. Lovely roof terrace with play area. Breakfast is good too.
reviews.title: IQ Roma - Just book it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This impressive little hotel was even better than advertised. Our impressions after a three night stay last month are these: CLEAN...not a speck of dirt or dust anywhere. MODERN...looked and felt brand new with no signs of wear. EFFICIENT...between the helpful desk clerks, housekeeping, and breakfast staff, we never lacked anything we needed. The hotel features an inexpensive laundry facility (no need for detergent as it is included in the machine) and vending machines that contain everything from feminine products to champagne at a reasonable cost. For example, water was cheaper in the machines than we found on the streets. We also enjoyed a nice bottle of Italian red wine for a whopping six Euros one night and could have purchased smaller bottles for less than that. LOVELY...the decor is typical modern European...think in terms of Ikea! An exceptional feature is the rooftop terrace which can be enjoyed in the morning during the breakfast buffet or the evening with the bottle of vino you just purchased from the machine! The terrace has plenty of comfortable seating and heat lamps to take away the night chill. We also enjoyed the gym facility and the sauna which, though small, were enough to maintain fitness. UNEXPECTED...we read other reviews suggesting that the breakfast buffet was overpriced and underwhelming...however our experience was just the opposite. The array of meats, cheeses, fruits, desserts, breads, salads, cereals, and beverages was staggering and delicious. For the price (10 euro) we ate enough high quality food to get us through longs days of walking through the Eternal City. The beverage machine alone is worth the price as I drank four excellent cappuccinos that would have cost me close to 7 euro alone. CONVENIENT...we found the location to be superb...close enough to walk to all of the major central attractions (we could reach the Forum in less than ten minutes or be at the Trevi in about the same) yet isolated enough to be quiet at night. The proximity to Termini was not problematic at all. In fact we walked though the area late at night and felt completely safe. With so much to offer and at such a reasonable cost we are already planning to stay in this little gem of a hotel when we return to beautiful Rome next year. Good travels!
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better

reviews.text: Myself, my husband and 10 year old daughter stayed here for 4 nights in early June. We used the hotel's car pick up service from the airport as this was very reasonably priced and convenient and the driver was very friendly, spoke English really well and talked us through the sites we passed on the way into the city.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the hotel the reception staff were very friendly and our room, which was a double with a sofa bed, was bigger than expected based on other reviews I'd read. The room and bathroom were spotless and as we overlooked the inner courtyard the room was also very quiet. As the corridor is very thickly carpeted you also got very little noise from people passing the room which made for a nice peaceful stay and allowed a really good nights sleep which you need to recover from all the walking.
reviews.title: It does exactly what it says on the tin - perfect hotel, perfect location

reviews.text: We had breakfast at the hotel each day which was nice and convenient with a good selection of food including bacon, eggs, bread, cold meats, cheese, pastries, cereal, fruit and hot and cold drinks. The waiting staff were attentive and nothing was too much trouble for them.
reviews.title: Modern hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the hotel is in such a great location we walked everywhere across Rome, the furthest place being the Vatican City which probably took about 45 minutes but didn't seem too far really even for my 10 year old.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: This hotel is newly renovated, well kept, and clean. Rooms are small but nice, even if the mattresses are a bit hard. The staff was friendly and did their best to be helpful. They have a really nice business center, but for some reason the internet always seemed to be down for the 3 days that we were there, which was annoying.
reviews.title: Nice, clean modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent hotel, friendly knowledgeable staff, spotless rooms, great location and great price.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An interesting concept for a hotel; but I don't care that a city centre hotel doesn't have room service or serve anything other than a breakfast. It has free wi-fi and beer and bottles of wine can be purchases from vending machines on every floor.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Brand New

reviews.text: I highly recommend a stay here.
reviews.title: Fabulous Find- Best hotel of my trip in Italy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for three nights during our honeymoon road trip through Europe. We stayed at over 20 hotels on our honeymoon and this hotel was one of our favorites. It was centrally located and just 1km from the train station. The roof top garden was a nice touch and with the hotel being brand new, everything was very clean and tidy. They have coin operated laundry which was useful and the staff were very friendly.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.text: GREAT location. Very ordinary room to look at but very clean and lovely shower. Best of all, huge vending machine with bottles of wine for under 10 euros that were really good, taken out onto their roof garden seating area and consumed whilst enjoying the evening sun and listening to the orchestra form the next door opera house, tune up for the evening performance! Not expensive and included a really good breakfast. Helpful staff. Near underground station.
reviews.title: Weekend in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after reading the reviews on TA. On the positive side, the staff were most willing and helpful. The hotel was modern and well located. Our room was located on the ground floor and was spacious. Unfortunately we stayed at the end of March during the heatwave and the staff could not work the air-con, making the room very uncomfortable. We were on a busy street, so couldn't open the windows. The main negative was the unbearably hard bed. We stayed for 5 nights and did not once get a good night's sleep and for us, it's a deal breaker and for that reason we wouldn't stay again.
reviews.title: Good stay let down by an awful bed and broken air con

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed hear on Tripadvisor recomendations and am definitely not dissappointed. We had a large double room which was VERY comfortable and very clean. The service is friendly and efficient. There's nothing I can say against the hotel. Close to Metro, Train station, sites and, within walking distance of some great little shops and restaurants. IQ is unlike any hotel I've stayed in before but a brilliant concept of self serve coupoled with personal service!!! Full marks to the cleaning staff, the kitchen staff and the front desk!
reviews.title: A Great find

reviews.text: Spending 2 weeks of time at Italy for my honeymoon and Roma is my first destination! Read so many good comments at tripadvisor regarding this hotel.. And finally I m here at the hotel writing the comment of it! The hotel location is very close to Roma Termini.. Just 10 mins walk and it is very easy to find it! Shops and restaurants around the place which u will definitely get what u need! The staff here are all very nice and everyone of them speak perfect English! The room is not big, but it is very clean and tidy! My wife even said their mattress is better than the one at our home! The breakfast that I just had is perfect!!! Everything of this hotel is perfect except they call the vetting machine as an iQ shop which I think very funny!!
reviews.title: The best of Roma!

reviews.text: My friends and I stayed at the IQ in March 2012 for three nights in a triple room. We loved the modern design of the hotel, its location to the Metro and Termini, and the large size of our room. It was clean, the outdoor garden was nice and the staff was very helpful. Friends staying at another hotel actually moved to the IQ because they liked our hotel better!!!
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel three nights, with 4 friends. We had 3 rooms, were all located together on the same floor, next to each other. After first night, room was not cleaned, as apparently there is some mystery do not disturb button in the room. Upon reporting the concern, the hotel quickly delivered fresh towels to us though, and the room was made up the next day. The room was a bit small, so there was not a good place to put the second suitcase, unless you unpacked and put the suitcase in the closet. Breakfast was good, and wished we had eaten the day we checked out as we got to termini and realized McDonalds' didn't have any breakfast food. Vending machine upstairs that I think was supposed to have the beer/wine was empty with a sign to check downstairs, but we really only were buying water, which was priced at 50 cents, so a great deal, since the next hotel vending machine in Milan was 2 euro. Internet access didn't work consistently. Would however definitely stay again if this continues to be priced competitively in the neighborhood.
reviews.title: Great modern remodeled hotel, decent location near Termini

reviews.text: We stayed here in Sept 2010 and had a wonderful stay. Hotel is very modern and new which is hard to find in Italy without paying a small fortune.The hotel is in a great location just around the corner from Piazza Della Republica and only a 10 minute walk to most attractions. We chose the double room which, while comfortable and smartly designed, was a little small for us so would recommend choosing a larger room. Inclusions like a laundry to wash ur own clothes ( which was a great help after 2 weeks of traveling ) and free wifi along with the friendliness of the staff made our stay in Rome very pleasant. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: We stayed here in Sept 2010 and had a...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The IQ Roma was a new concept to us - a hotel with no bar and no restaurant and if I am honest we chose it for its fabulous location near to the railway station (as we were travelling on to Florence later in the week) Its a new hotel and we were given a free upgrade on arrival _ nice touch . The bedroom was huge and the bathroom even more so - toilet , bedet, full bath with overhead shower and a seperate shower with massage jets. Gave us more sightseeing time as we showered simultanouesly ! The service at reception was outstanding - no seperate concierge just all multi tasking / knowledgeable receptionists ! There is a fabulous rooftop with luxurious sofas to curl up on in the evening - and a host of vending machines selling everything from toothpaste, to snacks, to alchohol. It may sound odd but a bottle of wine for 8 Euros to enjoy on the terrace - you wont find that elsewhere ! No overstuffy bartenders, no sweeties on your pillow and no fancy pen and notepad by the bed - just beautifully furnished contemporary rooms and competent friendly staff - we will certainly be back ! It doesnt have a restaurant but the buffet breakfast was beautiful and great value at 10 euros per person.
reviews.title: No frills just excellent accomodation and genuine quality customer care

reviews.text: I had recently spent a few nights in Rome in a quite distinguished hotel. I enjoyed the stay at the iQ hotel because of the many reasons that make this hotel really different from others in central Rome. The concept of the iQ hotel is to keep the room price as low as possible while providing the customer with a very good level of comfort. For example, the hotel doesn’t have a big restaurant or an expensive bar but instead an array of vending machines that provide the guests with all they need at prices that are even cheaper than the shops. There were laundry machines for a few Euros instead of an expensive laundry service. There is a fridge in the room that I was able to put drinks and light food items without being embarrassed of walking through the hotel lobby carrying plastic shopping bags. I didn't have my laptop with me although there was a free WiFi service but I was able to check my emails in the well equipped business centre for a few euros. There is a huge roof garden equipped with drinks machines of nice Italian wines and beers, snacks and sandwiches. The hotel was very modern and very nicely decorated, the room including the bathroom was spacious and comfortable and also quite which is a big plus considering being in such a noisy city like Rome. The bathroom had basic essentials like shampoo, soap, bath foam and a shower cap, anything else was available at the iQ shop across the corridor for a few coins. I fully recommend this guest oriented hotel to anyone who visits Rome and wants to enjoy a central, comfortable and not a very expensive stay in an expensive city.
reviews.title: The iQ Hotel, a good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my wife and i stayed here at the start of september the hotel is brand new so it is in perfect condition. the staff in the hotel are very helpful on our last evening we arranged an alarm call and asked about ordering a car to take us to the airport the staff arranged for a mercedes benz to take us which cost only 45 euros 5 more than a taxi at 40. the vending machines in the hotel sell wine for about 6 euros a bottle,beer 3 euros they even had smirnof ice and various snacks and sandwiches these could all be enjoyed on the roof terrace which was very tastefully decked out with seating there was also a small kids play area which i saw 1 kid using when we were there. There is a small gym and sauna on the 2nd floor with some free weights and cardio machines. the location of the hotel is ideal its on a quiet street just of one of the main streets through rome you could easily walk to all the major sights or there is a metro station just up the hill from the hotel the metro was safe and clean and easy to use 11euros for a 3 day unlimited use ticket. i will go back to rome and stay here again
reviews.title: great hotel, great location, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on our honeymoon so it was important the hotel was great. We are not fans of fancy hotels that provide facilities you never use, so IQ Roma seemed to fit the bill as we simply wanted a good, clean room at a fair price to use as our base for sightseeing.
reviews.title: A true gem - no-nonsense, modern, clean and well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Frankly, however, we were delighted with all aspects of the hotel. Friendly, multi-lingual staff. Excellent cleaning of the room. Lovely 24 hour roof terrace with a self-service bar that offers great selection at unbeatable value. Rome is very expensive and this hotel breaks the mould for value.
reviews.title: It's all good when its new!

reviews.text: I never thought I'd write such a glowing review - if you want no-hassle, clean, modern hotel which leaves money in your pocket for the important sightseeing/eating out, this is the place!
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: I really don't have anything bad to say about this hotel. It was the cheapest hotel during our whole european stay ($93 AUD p/nite) and it was the best hotel we stayed in! We booked the hotel on its first opening week and did have some doubts then because we couldn't find any reviews ~ boy were we surprised to find this plush gem!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Great Concept

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a small double room and it really is not that small - normal good size. Lovely modern furnishings and with great aircon throughout the whole establishment. Great concept of the vending machines as well ~ and good prices (especially the ice-tea!). Great facilities, gym, wifi, breakky, vending machines, upper terrace area, smokers courtyard and even free ice! (although probably best to provide ice buckets next time). The bed was cleand and comfy, shower had great pressure and staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for our stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really like this hotel.
reviews.title: Funky, Trendy, Minimal, Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First up, well placed. Very quiet little area, with the Teatro dell'Opera di Roma (Opera House) across the road. Lovely little Roman cafes around the area as well. Its easy to get to anywhere as it is located 4 mins from Repubblica Teatro dell'Opera Metro and 8 mins from Termini. A walk to Piazza del Colosseo is about 15-20 minutes, but its very up and down. The Metro is brilliant - and it DRASTICALLY reduced walking times.
reviews.title: iQ - a good choice

reviews.text: Service was brilliant.
reviews.title: Central location with all mod cons

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very new, and thus very nicely appointed in its minimal theme. The rooms are excellent. Clean and new. We had a room facing the Opera House - there was little or no street noise and we could sleep with the door to the balcony open.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.text: We didn't have breakfast at the hotel at all, as there are so many decent cafes around the area.
reviews.title: This hotel has everything you could want/need

description: The iQ Hotel Roma is a brand-new hotel in Rome downtown originating from an absolutely revolutionary concept. A fully customizable service, designed for modern travelers, who want the opportunity to choose all the conveniences offered by a modern four-star hotel, all options at a low cost.Whatever you require, you will find just outside your door; there are reasonably priced vendor machines throughout the Hotel.
